column1: Miami University IFC + Panhellenic Philanthropy,23774,"For 175 years, fraternities and sororities at Miami University have contributed to campus tradition, success, and pride. This rich heritage benefits both fraternity and sorority members and the broader university community.

Today, the University hosts over fifty fraternity and sorority chapters. Each chapter is committed to the Principles of the Greek Community: Scholarship & Learning, Service & Philanthropy, Leadership, Community, and Brotherhood & Sisterhood.

Last year, Miami Greeks donated countless hours and thousands of dollars to both local and national charities through service projects and philanthropic fundraisers.",,2017-04-03 19:59:44,miami-university,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Miami-University-1.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Michigan State IFC Philanthropy,23789,"Fraternities offer the most comprehensive student experience at Michigan State. Activities ranging from sports to service to academic-oriented experiences. Many fraternities host social events for their members, offer scholarships to those who members deserving of academic recognition, plan large trips for their members, and promote leadership development through various programs and opportunities.

Each fraternity is different, focusing on their core beliefs and what their membership wish to achieve in their time at the University. Check out the IFC Chapters page to see information about each Fraternity Chapter at Michigan State.

At Michigan State University our IFC Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations.",,2017-04-03 21:42:10,michigan-state-ifc,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Michigan-State-IFC.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
University of Cincinnati Panhellenic Philanthropy,23798,"At the University of Cincinnati, our Panhellenic Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations.
Northwestern University Panhellenic Philanthropy,23801,"At Northwestern University, our Panhellenic Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations.

Penn State IFC + Panhellenic Philanthropy,23803,"The Penn State fraternity and sorority community is one of the largest communities in North America and consists of a diverse group of men and women within our chapters. We ensure that our organizations are focused and dedicated to serving their national philanthropies as well as other efforts within the community. Through these actions we understand and respect that our service is an integral part of the community’s well being.

Collectively, our community raises approximately $200,000 each year for a variety of philanthropies!",,2017-04-04 13:05:26,penn-state-ifc-panhellenic,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Penn-State-IFC-Panhellenic.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Oklahoma State Greek Life,23805,"The OSU fraternity and sorority community is comprised of members of both men’s and women’s fraternities and sororities.  Today, over 5,000 students are strong and vital members of the community. We are proud to have a thriving system on campus with numerous, diverse nationally recognized fraternities and sororities represented.

As a community, we are committed to philanthropy and each of our chapters hold philanthropy events each semester to raise money for a variety of different philanthropic partners.",,2017-04-04 13:10:27,oklahoma-state-greek-life,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/OSU-Greek-Life.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
UC Davis IFC Philanthropy,23807,"At UC Davis, our IFC Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations.

Florida State University IFC,23809,"​The Interfraternity Council (IFC) at Florida State University is the governing body for 21 men’s fraternities on campus. The Interfraternity Council is dedicated to the academic and social development of its respective fraternities and their members.
Members in IFC organizations are active in every aspect of campus and we raise over $250,000 annually for a variety of philanthropies.

University of Texas Panhellenic Philanthropy,23906,"Hook 'Em! The University Panhellenic Council (UPC) governs the fourteen National Panhellenic Conference affiliated sororities at The University of Texas at Austin.

Panhellenic women participate in thousands of service hours each year. In addition, all UPC sororities support both local and national philanthropic causes, raising over $225,000 in philanthropic contributions annually.

In addition to philanthropy at the chapter level, the University Panhellenic Council organizes annual philanthropy events to benefit Circle of Sisterhood - an organization that gives sorority and fraternity women the opportunity to help and give back to those who are unable to afford or receive a proper education. With our help, women in third-world countries are given a chance to attend school and are provided with school supplies. As a community, we will fundraise and spread awareness for this great cause. Circle of Sisterhood provides education that will decrease women's risk of domestic violence, health problems, and illiteracy around the world. Circle of Sisterhood is nationwide, global, and it all starts with us. Let's make a change for women everywhere.",,2017-04-05 14:15:20,university-texas-panhellenic,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/UT-Panhellenic.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

University of Virginia ISC Philanthropy,23908,"The Inter-Sorority Council at UVA is currently the largest group of women on Grounds with over 2300 members in 16 sororities. The ISC at the University of Virginia strives to uphold the values of integrity, loyalty, compassion, and humility, upon which the organizations were founded. Sorority involvement enhances the experience of all current and future sorority women by providing resources and opportunities for scholarship, leadership, service, and social development in an atmosphere conducive to friendship and sisterhood.

The Greek community donates more than 40,000 hours of service and $50,000 in philanthropy efforts each year. Initiatives benefit local communities, such as the Charlottesville Ronald McDonald House, the UVA Children’s Hospital and local community tutoring programs, but service extends to other, global efforts, such as supporting cancer research and the victims of sexual assault. In addition to individual chapter efforts, a variety of cross-council collaborations and programs occur throughout the year, including the InterGreek Habitat House, the Mid-Autumns Carnival, which benefits local elementary education, and the Crimson War Blood Drive with the University of Maryland.",,2017-04-05 14:40:28,university-virginia-isc,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/UVA-ISC.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
East Carolina University IFC Philanthropy,23911,"The InterFraternity Council (IFC) is a self-governing body representing the seventeen member fraternities at East Carolina University.

IFC strives to promote excellence in all aspects of fraternal life and excellence in academia. In addition, the Council also works together to help the ECU Greek Community in its entirety better achieve its common goal of membership development and service to the city of Greenville and the Eastern North Carolina region.

At East Carolina University, our IFC Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations.",,2017-04-05 14:54:32,east-carolina-university-ifc,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/East-Carolina-IFC.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

University of Maryland Panhellenic Philanthropy,23913,"

Right now, the University of Maryland PHC has about 2000 active members across our 16 chapters, and we see our numbers grow every year. We are dedicated to philanthropy and service in the following ways:

Each chapter supports their own philanthropy and hosts events throughout the year to raise money and/or awareness for these causes. These activities range from sporting events to fashion shows to cookouts and are fun to host as well as attend and participate in other chapters' events.

Besides just hosting events for their philanthropies, chapters also participate in service activities to help their community. Some chapters visit nursing homes, while others may sponsor an Adopt-a-Road and clean up trash in the area.
One of Greek life's biggest causes is Terp Thon and Greeks as a whole raise a majority of the money and are a huge presence at this danceathon.

The Panhellenic Association has its own philanthropy, Circle of Sisterhood, which raises money to send girls in developing countries to school. We raise money during Homecoming/Greek Week and other events throughout the year and host Circle of Sisterhood Week in October.

column1: Florida Atlantic University Panhellenic Association,24198,"In this past year, the FAU Panhellenic Community has logged nearly 3,100 hours of community service and has raised over 54,000 in philanthropy dollars. Service and Philanthropy a very big component to why our organizations were founded. We take pride in this by being a integral part of our community.

Our Panhellenic Council has adopted The Circle of Sisterhood Foundation as our official philanthropy for 2017. Circle of Sisterhood is a non-profit organization founded and powered by sorority women on a mission to raise financial resources to help remove education barriers for girls and women facing poverty and oppression. Our goal is to raise enough money to build a school in partnership with The Circle of Sisterhood Foundation. Please join us in supporting this amazing organization!",,2017-04-14 14:24:56,florida-atlantic-university-panhellenic-association,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/FAUPanhellenic-1.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Louisiana State University Greek Philanthropy,24286,"LSU Greeks contribute many hours each semester to raise money for philanthropies and perform service projects. The opportunities to help others are endless. From children’s hospitals to cancer foundations, LSU Greeks are active in supporting worthy causes.",,2017-04-18 20:28:06,lsu-greek-life,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/LSU-GL-Dashboard-Featured-Images.jpg,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

University of Colorado Boulder Panhellenic Philanthropy,24298,"The CU Panhellenic Sororities sponsor a multitude of activities each year to impact the local community and earn money for their special philanthropies or identified causes. Each chapter also donates its time to a particular project either locally or nationally.

Sorority women can be found helping freshmen move into their residence halls, working blood drives and participating in off-campus projects with retirement communities, day cares, and local food banks!",,2017-04-18 22:20:14,cu-philanthropy,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/CU-Dashboard-Featured-Images.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

column1: University of Oregon IFC Philanthropy,24408,"The Interfraternity Council (IFC) is the governing board of all eighteen recognized fraternities at the University of Oregon. We aspire to promote a culture of leadership, service, brotherhood, and scholarship within our community and build stronger men. At the University of Oregon, our IFC Chapters are very involved in many different types of philanthropic organizations!",,2017-05-19 18:10:02,university-oregon-ifc,4,publish,https://www.greeks4good.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/University-of-Oregon-IFC.png,,,0,closed,default,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
